result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon R Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With credit for 1 day.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

**Court ordered expungement effective immediately at today's proceedings, State does not object.
Court will waive costs and surcharges due to reasons stated on the record that case should have never been charged.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon R Lewis

defendant.name: Lewis, Brandon R
defendant.address: 2390 South Kinnickinnic Avenue Apt 6, Milwaukee, WI 53207

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's request for return of seized property (money).
Court ordered expungement effective immediately at today's proceedings, State does not object.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentences defendant to serve 1 day in the House of Correction with credit for 1 (one) day, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court will waive costs and surcharges due to reasons stated on the record that case should have never been charged.

Court ordered expungement effective immediately at today's proceedings, state does not object.

-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

Defendant Brandon R Lewis in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Honorable Judge Paul J. Rifelj handled plea ONLY:

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Brandon R Lewis in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pre-trial conference.   All parties are notified that effective 12-1-15 this case will be assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandon R Lewis in court.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 10-19-2015 at 01:30pm

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
09-05-2015
